Sequence Information.Peptide Name: RANATUERIN-2La (Ranatuerin 2La,  also called anatuerin-2PRa; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; XXU; 1S=S, UCSS1a)
Sequence Information.Source: North American frog,Rana luteiventris, ALSO: the Oregon spotted frogRana pretiosa

Literature Information.Literature: Chemical modification:  Disulfide bridge: C27,C32.Discovery: Ranatuerin-2PRa found in the Oregon spotted frog shares the same sequence with this entry (Conlon JM et al 2011 Dev Comp Immunol Feb 1, 35:644â€“649). For other Ranatuerin-2PR peptides, see AP1716 and subsequent entries.Activity: strongly active against S. aureus (MIC 11 uM), E. coli (MIC 4 uM), and C.albicans (MIC> 150 uM).  Also active against B. dendrobatidis (Table 1, Rollins-Smith, BBA 2009; 1788:1593-1599). Found in multiple species. Updated 3/2015; 7/2021; 11/2023.
Literature Information.Author: Goraya J, Wang Y, Li Z, O'Flaherty M, Knoop FC, Platz JE, Conlon JM.2000
Literature Information.Title: Peptides with antimicrobial activity from four different families isolated from the skins of the North American frogs Rana luteiventris, Rana berlandieri and Rana pipiens.
